intro: Macrocarpaea stenophylla, commonly known as the narrow-leaf macrocarpaea, is a species of flowering plant in the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its narrow, linear leaves and produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in dense clusters. Native to South Africa, this plant thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and full sun exposure. It is often found in mountainous regions and is adapted to arid or semi-arid climates. The plant's botanical features make it a unique and resilient species within its native habitat.
